"You may be a drunkard, vile man, but I am not!" Lebeziatnikov shouted. 

Luzhin sneered. "Are you crazy, milksop?" 

"I saw it," Lebeziatnikov insisted. "He gave Sofya Semyonovna that hundred-rouble note. Iâ€™ll take my oath!" 

Luzhin's face turned pale. "What lies! How could you see it?" 

"I saw everything," Lebeziatnikov replied. "You slipped it into her pocket. I thought it was kindness!" 

Luzhin scoffed. "You fancied it with your short-sighted eyes." 

"No, I didn't. I know it was a hundred-rouble note." 

Luzhin's anger flared. "You are raving!" 

The tension crackled in the room.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Lebeziatnikov accuses Luzhin of deceitfully giving a hundred-rouble note to Sofya, contradicting Luzhin's claim of only giving her ten roubles.
